and will secure to him the support of every good
citizen in the discharge of his duty. It is, therefore, expected that members of the department
shall be civil and respectful to the public, and shall
on all occasions perform their duty with good
temper and discretion ; and must not, at any time,
make use of violent, intemperate or abusive language.
Sec. 9. No member will be permitted to apply
for a warrant, for an assault upon himself without
first reporting the case to the Chief of Police, and
obtaining from him or from the Mayor, permision
in writing to make such application. The object
-of this Section is to guard against unnecessary
and vexatious prosecutions, whilst, at the same
time, members will be efficiently protected by
every legal means in all cases that require protec-
Sec. 10. No member shall communicate to any
persons any information which may lead to the
escape from arrest or punishment of persons accused of crimes or misdemeanors; or which may
enable them to dispose of or secrete any goods
stolen or embezzled.
